Target: 1whenever I would heal Israel,

Source: 1Boaj lé ḭ aw tarəwkɔg’d lə ɓee lé ɓa si naŋg keneŋ. Ndá aa oo, yeḛ gə́ to gə́ njenoji lə dee gə́ pər gə́ askəm kaa dɔ dee gə́ Boaj pata ləa kédé lé a gə dəs. Boaj ulá pana: I lé tel ree si nee!
Target: 1Meanwhile Boaz went up to the town gate and sat down there just as the guardian-redeemer#4:1The Hebrew word forguardian-redeemeris a legal term for one who has the obligation to redeem a relative in serious difficulty (see Lev. 25:25-55); also in verses 3, 6, 8 and 14.he had mentioned came along. Boaz said, “Come over here, my friend, and sit down.” So he went over and sat down.

Source: 1Mee ləb ko̰ɓee lə Tiber Sesar gə́ aḭ dɔg-giree-mi lé to mee ləb gə́ Po̰sə Pilatə to ne njeguburuɓee gə́ Jude ləm, Herɔdə to ne njeguburu dəb ɓee gə́ Galile ləm, ŋgokea̰ Pilibə kara to ne njeguburu dəb ɓee gə́ Ituree gə dɔ naŋg gə́ gugu dɔ Trakonitə ləma, Lisanias to ne njeguburu dəb ɓee gə́ Abilene ləm tɔ.
Target: 1In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar—when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, Herod tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip tetrarch of Iturea and Traconitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene—

Source: 1Jɔb tel ilá keneŋ pana:
Target: 1Then Job replied:

Target: 1Israel was a spreading vine;

Target: 1The word of theLordcame to me:

Target: 1Saul told his son Jonathan and all the attendants to kill David. But Jonathan had taken a great liking to David

Target: 1The heavens declare the glory of God;

Target: 1Then the whole assembly rose and led him off to Pilate.

Target: 1King Belshazzar gave a great banquet for a thousand of his nobles and drank wine with them.

Target: 1Woe to the city of blood,

Target: 1“Hear this, you priests!

Target: 1Three days after arriving in the province, Festus went up from Caesarea to Jerusalem,

Source: 1Maji kar dəwje kára-kára lai d’oso kul no̰ njéko̰ɓeeje’g ya, mbata gin ko̰ɓee gə́ rara kara gə́ a lal kḭ rɔ Ala’g lé godo ləm, deḛ gə́ d’isi gə́ njéko̰ɓeeje lé kara Ala nja gə́ njekunda dee keneŋ ləm tɔ.
Target: 1Let everyone be subject to the governing authorities, for there is no authority except that which God has established. The authorities that exist have been established by God.

Source: 1Pakɔs pidi lə Dabid.
Target: 1I will exalt you, my God the King;

Source: 1Ben-Adad, mbai gə́ Siri mbo̰ njérɔje ləa lai, mbaije rɔ-munda-gir-dee-joo d’ɔm səa na̰’d gə kundaje gə pusu-rɔje lə dee tɔ. Yeḛ aḭ dɔ Samari sub rɔ səa tɔ.
Target: 1Now Ben-Hadad king of Aram mustered his entire army. Accompanied by thirty-two kings with their horses and chariots, he went up and besieged Samaria and attacked it.

Source: 1Ma m’to pudu gə́ uba ndag-loo gə́ Saron ləm,
Target: 1I am a rose#2:1Probably a member of the crocus familyof Sharon,

Target: 1I saw in heaven another great and marvelous sign: seven angels with the seven last plagues—last, because with them God’s wrath is completed.

Target: 1“At this my heart pounds

Target: 1Now the whole world had one language and a common speech.

Source: 1Njesigənea̰ ulam ta gə rɔtaje nee pana:
Target: 1The word of theLordcame to me:

Source: 1Loo gə́ Ejekias oo taje neelé ndá yeḛ til kubuje ləa hao̰-hao̰ rəa’g, ya̰ ula kubu-kwa-ndòo rəa’g tɔɓəi ɔd aw ne mee kəi’g lə Njesigənea̰ tɔ.
Target: 1When King Hezekiah heard this, he tore his clothes and put on sackcloth and went into the temple of theLord.

Source: 1Njesigənea̰ ula Moyis pana:
Target: 1TheLordsaid to Moses:

Source: 1Pakɔs lə Dabid.
Target: 1My heart, O God, is steadfast;

Source: 1Oiyo, ta gə́ m’a gə pa lé lé seḭ ooje gə́ ta mbə lam kara ma m’ndigi kar sí taaje ya. Ma m’gər gao seḭ a taaje ya.
Target: 1I hope you will put up with me in a little foolishness. Yes, please put up with me!

Source: 1Njesigənea̰ ulam ta gə rɔtaje nee pana:
Target: 1The word of theLordcame to me:

Source: 1Togə́bè ɓa ma m’wɔji məəm’g njaŋg gə mba tel kaw ɓee lə sí kaw kula kəm sí ndòo el ŋga.
Target: 1So I made up my mind that I would not make another painful visit to you.

Source: 1Gée gə́ gogo, m’oo kuraje lə Ala gə́ dara sɔ gə́ d’aar tar dɔ kum naŋg gə́ sɔ’g lé d’wa lel gə́ tel kəmee ula ɓəd-ɓəd loo-sɔ dɔ naŋg nee gə mba karee ula dɔ naŋg nee el ləm, əsé gə dɔ baa-boo-kad’g el ləma, əsé gə dɔ kagje gə́ rara kara el ləm tɔ#Jer 49.36, LkD 7.2, Jkr 6.5.
Target: 1After this I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, holding back the four winds of the earth to prevent any wind from blowing on the land or on the sea or on any tree.

Source: 1Njesigənea̰ ula Moyis pana:
Target: 1TheLordsaid to Moses,

Source: 1Dəwje gə́ Eprayim mbo̰ dɔ na̰ d’aw par gə́ dɔgel ndá deḛ dəji Jepte pana: See mbata ɗi ɓa i aw rɔ gə Amo̰je lal ɓar sí kar sí j’aw səi wa. Jeḛ ndigije rooi gə kəi ləi na̰’d ya.
Target: 1The Ephraimite forces were called out, and they crossed over to Zaphon. They said to Jephthah, “Why did you go to fight the Ammonites without calling us to go with you? We’re going to burn down your house over your head.”

Source: 1Né gə́ kédé gə́ ma m’tɔgi dɔ’g lé maji ra tamaji ta Ala’g ləm, ra ndòo rəa’g ləm, to ne təa’g pəgə-pəgə ləma, rəa oiyo ləm tɔ mbata lə dəwje lai ləm,
Target: 1I urge, then, first of all, that petitions, prayers, intercession and thanksgiving be made for all people—

Source: 1Mee naḭ gə́ njekɔm’g dɔg mee ləb gə́ njekɔm’g jinaikara gə́ Sedesias, mbai gə́ Juda o̰ ne ɓee lé ndá, Nebukadnesar mbai gə́ Babilɔn ree gə njérɔje ləa lai d’aḭ ne dɔ Jerusalem sub gə rɔ.
Target: 1In the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon marched against Jerusalem with his whole army and laid siege to it.

Source: 1Dəwje d’ɔr soree d’aw ne wəg-wəg pana: Ta kaiya to mbuna sí’g, nɛ gar kaiya neelé dəw a kiŋga bèe ɓee lə njépole-magəje el. Diŋgam kára taa dené lə bɔbeeje si səa mbuna sí’g nee#TtG 23.1.
Target: 1It is actually reported that there is sexual immorality among you, and of a kind that even pagans do not tolerate: A man is sleeping with his father’s wife.

Source: 1Njesigənea̰ ula Aaro̰ pana: I seḭ gə ŋganije, gə ŋgako̰ síje gə́ to gə́ ginkoji’g lə Ləbi səi na̰’d lé ta néra kori-korije gə́ deḛ ra mee kəi-kubu-si-Ala’g lé a kwa dɔ sí-seḭ ya, nɛ néra kori-korije gə́ d’a ra loo kula ra sí gə́ wɔji dɔ loo-nékinjaməs lé taree a kwa dɔ sí-seḭ nja ba.
Target: 1TheLordsaid to Aaron, “You, your sons and your family are to bear the responsibility for offenses connected with the sanctuary, and you and your sons alone are to bear the responsibility for offenses connected with the priesthood.

Source: 1Meeko̰ a koso dɔ ɓee-boo gə́ Samari
Target: 1Woe to that wreath, the pride of Ephraim’s drunkards,

Source: 1Tamaji gə́ Habakuk, njetegginta ra asəna gə pa no̰ ndòo bèe.
Target: 1A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet. Onshigionoth.#3:1Probably a literary or musical term

Source: 1Ndərta gə́ Njesigənea̰ pa wɔji ne dɔ Israɛl.
Target: 1A prophecy: The word of theLordconcerning Israel.

Source: 1Njemeeyèr mbudu ŋgwɔd aḭ al kar dəw kore gée ləm,
Target: 1The wicked flee though no one pursues,

Source: 1Mee ɓee gə́ Samari lé ŋgalə Akab gə́ diŋgam deḛ rɔ-siri d’isi keneŋ. Ndá Jehu ndaŋg maktubje ula ne ar mbaije gə́ Jisreel ləm, gə ŋgatɔgje ləma, gə njékaa dɔ ŋgalə Akab lé ləm tɔ, ula dee pana:
Target: 1Now there were in Samaria seventy sons of the house of Ahab. So Jehu wrote letters and sent them to Samaria: to the officials of Jezreel,#10:1Hebrew; some Septuagint manuscripts and Vulgateof the cityto the elders and to the guardians of Ahab’s children. He said,

Source: 1Pakɔs lə Asap.
Target: 1God presides in the great assembly;

Source: 1Samel ula Sawul pana: Ma lé Njesigənea̰ ulam mba kam m’wa dɔi gə ubu m’undai ne gə́ mbai dɔ koso-dəwje gə́ Israɛl. Bèe ndá maji kari oo ta gə́ Njesigənea̰ ɓa pa#1Sam 10.1.
Target: 1Samuel said to Saul, “I am the one theLordsent to anoint you king over his people Israel; so listen now to the message from theLord.

Source: 1Njesigənea̰ ulam ta gə rɔtaje nee pana:
Target: 1The word of theLordcame to me:

Source: 1Mee ndəa’g neelé deḛ tura maktub lə Moyis kəm koso-dəwje’g lai ndá d’iŋga ta kára gə́ ndaŋg keneŋ pana: Dəw gə́ to gə́ ginkoji Amo̰’g əsé gə ginkoji Moab’g lé a kandə loo-mbo̰-dɔ-na̰’g lə dəwje lə Ala nda̰ el#TtG 23.4-6
Target: 1On that day the Book of Moses was read aloud in the hearing of the people and there it was found written that no Ammonite or Moabite should ever be admitted into the assembly of God,

Source: 1Pakɔs lə Dabid.
Target: 1TheLordis my shepherd, I lack nothing.

Source: 1Jakob si ɓee gə́ Kana̰, loo gə́ bɔbeeje si keneŋ kédé lé.
Target: 1Jacob lived in the land where his father had stayed, the land of Canaan.

Source: 1Ndɔje dəs bula lam ndá Jeju tel aw Kapernawum. D’oo to gə́ yeḛ si mee kəi’g
Target: 1A few days later, when Jesus again entered Capernaum, the people heard that he had come home.

Source: 1Seḭje gə́ Moab, ulaje gə ŋgan badje
Target: 1Send lambs as tribute

Source: 1Unje to̰to̰ undaje ta sí’g!
Target: 1“Put the trumpet to your lips!

Source: 1Darius, dəw gə́ Medə gə́ ləb kojee aḭ rɔ-misa̰-giree-joo lé ɓa taa ɓeeko̰ lé o̰.
Target: 1It pleased Darius to appoint 120 satraps to rule throughout the kingdom,

Source: 1Dəw kára si dɔ mbal’d gə́ Eprayim ria lə Mika.
Target: 1Now a man named Micah from the hill country of Ephraim

Source: 1Mee ndəaje’g neelé boo-dəwje mbo̰ dɔ na̰ kəmlə-kəmlə rəa’g tɔɓəi, nɛ d’oo nésɔ dee el, ndá Jeju ɓar njékwakiláje ula dee pana:
Target: 1During those days another large crowd gathered. Since they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to him and said,

Source: 1Ta lə nékulje gə́ deḛ d’inja gə́ məs d’ar magəje ɓa d’ya̰ dakasee lé kəm síjeḛ lai inja dɔ’g ar sí n’gər gosee gao. Gosɔnégər lé ar dəwje ti ne rɔ dee ya nɛ meenoji ɓa dəw a rɔd ne maree.
Target: 1Now about food sacrificed to idols: We know that “We all possess knowledge.” But knowledge puffs up while love builds up.

Source: 1Tamaji lə Dabid.
Target: 1Hear me,Lord, and answer me,

Source: 1Bèe ɓa Moyis gə Israɛlje d’ɔs pa nee d’ar Njesigənea̰. Deḛ pana:
Target: 1Then Moses and the Israelites sang this song to theLord:

Source: 1See j’a pa ba̰ dɔ ta’g nee wa. See j’a nai gin kaiya’g ɓa gə mba kar noji ḭ ne dɔ maree’g gə́ kédé-kédé wa.
Target: 1What shall we say, then? Shall we go on sinning so that grace may increase?

Source: 1Jakob oo sor kó gə́ to Ejiptə ndá yeḛ ula ŋganeeje pana: See gelee ban ɓa seḭ aaje kəm na̰ togə́bè wa.
Target: 1When Jacob learned that there was grain in Egypt, he said to his sons, “Why do you just keep looking at each other?”

Source: 1Juje ḭta gə ndɔ rad ar Israɛlje lai d’ḭ səa na̰’d ɓee gə́ Sitim d’ɔd d’aw ndá deḛ teḛ ta baa’d gə́ Jurdɛ̰, lée’g neelé deḛ to naŋg keneŋ loondul’g ɓa gə mba bèlè gaŋg baa lé ɓəi.
Target: 1Early in the morning Joshua and all the Israelites set out from Shittim and went to the Jordan, where they camped before crossing over.

Source: 1Mee ndəa’g neelé i a pa pana:
Target: 1In that day you will say:

Source: 1Maji kar sí ndolèje goo meenoji. Narje rɔ sí gə mba kiŋga nénoji gə́ wɔji dɔ ndil sí tɔ nɛ ka̰ tegginta ɓa areeje ur dɔ dee’g lai.
Target: 1Follow the way of love and eagerly desire gifts of the Spirit, especially prophecy.

Source: 1Loo gə́ Esdras oso naŋg bəbərə gə mán-no̰ kəmee’g ra ne tamaji neelé teg ne gin kaiya neelé ndá koso-Israɛlje bula ree mbo̰ dɔ na̰ rəa’g, diŋgamje ləm, gə denéje ləma, gə ŋganje ləm tɔ, dəwje neelé no̰ gə mán-no̰ kəm dee’g ɓugudu-ɓugudu.
Target: 1While Ezra was praying and confessing, weeping and throwing himself down before the house of God, a large crowd of Israelites—men, women and children—gathered around him. They too wept bitterly.

Source: 1Samel ula Israɛlje lai pana: Aa ooje, ma m’oo ndu sí dɔ taje lai’d gə́ seḭ ulamje ndá ma m’unda mbai lé dɔ sí’g mba̰.
Target: 1Samuel said to all Israel, “I have listened to everything you said to me and have set a king over you.

Source: 1Nɛ dəw kára ria lə Ananias gə dené ləa Sapira ndogo loo-ndɔ ləa
Target: 1Now a man named Ananias, together with his wife Sapphira, also sold a piece of property.

Source: 1Imje to̰to̰ mee ɓee gə́ Sio̰’g!
Target: 1Blow the trumpet in Zion;

Source: 1Un kudee Dan saar teḛ Beer-Seba gə ɓee gə́ Galaad lé Israɛlje lai d’unda loo teḛ ndá koso-dəwje mbo̰ dɔ na̰ to gə́ dəw gə́ kára ba bèe no̰ Njesigənea̰’g loo gə́ Mispa.
Target: 1Then all Israel from Dan to Beersheba and from the land of Gilead came together as one and assembled before theLordin Mizpah.

Source: 1Aa ooje, ndutɔr gə́ Moyis, dəw lə Ala tɔr dɔ Israɛlje’g kédé ɓa wəi ɓəi lé ɓa nee:
Target: 1This is the blessing that Moses the man of God pronounced on the Israelites before his death.

Source: 1Pakɔs kḭ kaw tuga ne loo ɗao-ɗao gə́ tar.
Target: 1Out of the depths I cry to you,Lord;

Source: 1Kura gə́ dara gə́ njekwɔji səm ta lé tel ree ndá yeḛ ndelm to gə́ dəw gə́ ndelee dɔ ɓi’g bèe.
Target: 1Then the angel who talked with me returned and woke me up, like someone awakened from sleep.

Source: 1Loo gə́ Koso-dəwje d’oo to gə́ Moyis ḭ dɔ mbal’g tel ree kalaŋ el ndá deḛ mbo̰ dɔ na̰ rɔ Aaro̰’g d’ulá pana: Ḭta, aw ra magə ar sí mba karee njaa no̰ sí’g mbata Moyis nee gə́ ar sí j’unda loo mee ɓee gə́ Ejiptə n’teḛje lé jeḛ n’gərje né gə́ teḛ dəa’g el#NNk 7.40.
Target: 1When the people saw that Moses was so long in coming down from the mountain, they gathered around Aaron and said, “Come, make us gods#32:1Ora god; also in verses 23 and 31who will go before us. As for this fellow Moses who brought us up out of Egypt, we don’t know what has happened to him.”

Source: 1Dabid pana: See dəw kára mbuna njémeekəije’g lə Sawul nai gə mba kam m’ra səa meemaji mbata lə Jonatan ya el wa#1Sam 20.15-17.
Target: 1David asked, “Is there anyone still left of the house of Saul to whom I can show kindness for Jonathan’s sake?”

Source: 1Ndərta gə́ inja kəm Esai, ŋgolə Amots’g aree oo wɔji ne dɔ Judaje gə Jerusalemje mee ndəa gə́ Ojias gə Jotam gə Akaj gə Ejekias to ne mbaije gə́ Juda lé#2Mb 15.1-7, 15.32–16.20, 18.1–20.21, 2SgI 26.1–32.33.
Target: 1The vision concerning Judah and Jerusalem that Isaiah son of Amoz saw during the reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

Source: 1Sɔ goŋ muru gə́ tudu gə meekulɔm
Target: 1Better a dry crust with peace and quiet

Source: 1Pa lə Dabid gə́ ar bao-pa mba karee ɔs sə dee lé.
Target: 1Have mercy on me, O God,

Source: 1Njesigənea̰ ula Moyis gə Aaro̰ pana:
Target: 1TheLordsaid to Moses and Aaron,

Source: 1Moyis ɓar Israɛlje lai ula dee pana: Loo gə́ seḭ síje mee ɓee gə́ Ejiptə lé, seḭ ooje néje lai gə́ Njesigənea̰ ra kəm sí’g gə Parao̰ gə kuraje ləa lai gə ɓee ləa lai ləm,
Target: 1These are the terms of the covenant theLordcommanded Moses to make with the Israelites in Moab, in addition to the covenant he had made with them at Horeb.

Source: 1Mee naḭ gə́ njekɔm’g munda gə́ orè goo kunda gə́ deḛ d’unda loo mee ɓee gə́ Ejiptə teḛ lé, mee ndəa’gən lé Israɛlje teḛ dɔdilaloo gə́ Sinai.
Target: 1On the first day of the third month after the Israelites left Egypt—on that very day—they came to the Desert of Sinai.

Source: 1Némḭdi gə́ Mbaidɔmbaije gə́ Njesigənea̰ tɔjim am m’oo ɓa nee: Aa ooje, yeḛ ra beedéje gə́ bula dèm-dèm loo gə́ barkəmko uba gogo sigi lé, to da-kó gə́ uba goo kó gə́ d’inja d’ar mbai kédé lé.
Target: 1This is what the SovereignLordshowed me: He was preparing swarms of locusts after the king’s share had been harvested and just as the late crops were coming up.

Source: 1Ndɔ gə́ doŋgɔr lə naḭ gə́ njekɔm’g joo, mee ləb gə́ njekɔm’g joo gə́ orè goo kunda gə́ d’unda loo mee ɓee gə́ Ejiptə teḛ lé Njesigənea̰ ula Moyis ta dɔdilaloo gə́ Sinai mee kəi-kwa-dɔ-na̰’g pana#BI 26.1-51:
Target: 1TheLordspoke to Moses in the tent of meeting in the Desert of Sinai on the first day of the second month of the second year after the Israelites came out of Egypt. He said:

Source: 1Dəwje gə́ Kirjat-Yearim ree d’un sa̰duk-manrɔ lə Njesigənea̰ lé d’aw ne kəi lə Abinadab gə́ to dɔdərloo’g ndá deḛ d’unda ŋgonee gə́ Eləajar gə kəmee mba karee ŋgəm sa̰duk-manrɔ lə Njesigənea̰ lé#2Sam 6.2-4, 1SgI 13.5-7.
Target: 1So the men of Kiriath Jearim came and took up the ark of theLord. They brought it to Abinadab’s house on the hill and consecrated Eleazar his son to guard the ark of theLord.

Source: 1Togə́bè yeḛ gə́ njekwa nénduba lé loo gə́ nai ŋgon gə́ gɔ ɓəi, lé yeḛ to ne gə́ njenéje lai kara yeḛ nai asəna gə ɓər ɓəi.
Target: 1What I am saying is that as long as an heir is underage, he is no different from a slave, although he owns the whole estate.

Source: 1Pakɔs lə Dabid gə́ ar bao-pa mba karee ɔs sə dee lé.
Target: 1Shout for joy to God, all the earth!

Source: 1Jeju un kəmee gə́ tar aa ne loo oo baoje gə́ d’ɔm nékar-Alaje lə dee mee sa̰duk-kɔm-lar’g lé.
Target: 1As Jesus looked up, he saw the rich putting their gifts into the temple treasury.

Source: 1Loo gə́ taree wəi bèm mba̰ ndá Pool mbo̰ njékwakiláje dɔ na̰’d. Loo gə́ yeḛ ndəji dee ndá yeḛ ra dee ne lapia ɓa ḭ mba kaw dəb ɓeeko̰ gə́ Masedoinə ɓəi.
Target: 1When the uproar had ended, Paul sent for the disciples and, after encouraging them, said goodbye and set out for Macedonia.

Source: 1Pidije Njesigənea̰.
Target: 1Praise theLord.#112:1HebrewHallelu Yah

Source: 1Elihu un ta pa ɓəi pana:
Target: 1Then Elihu said:

Source: 1Loo gə́ dəw a gə kun nékinjaməs gə́ ka̰ kɔm na̰’d gə Njesigənea̰ ndá ɓó lé yeḛ a kwa da-kul gə́ boi, lé to gə́ bɔ maŋg əsé ko̰ maŋg kara yeḛ a kwa yee gə́ rəa mina̰ el ɓa a kaw ne no̰ Njesigənea̰’g ɓəi.
Target: 1“ ‘If your offering is a fellowship offering, and you offer an animal from the herd, whether male or female, you are to present before theLordan animal without defect.

Source: 1Ta gə́ Njesigənea̰ ula Jeremi, loo gə́ mbai Sedesias ula Pasur, ŋgolə Malkija, gə Soponi ŋgolə Maaséja, njekinjanéməs lé rəa’g mba kar dee d’ulá pana:
Target: 1The word came to Jeremiah from theLordwhen King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur son of Malkijah and the priest Zephaniah son of Maaseiah. They said:

Source: 1Akab ɔr goo néje lai gə́ Eli ra ar dené ləa Jejabel oo ləm, aree oo loo tɔl gə́ yeḛ tɔl njéteggintaje lai gə kiambas lé ləm tɔ.
Target: 1Now Ahab told Jezebel everything Elijah had done and how he had killed all the prophets with the sword.

Source: 1Juje gə́ to ŋgolə Nun lé, loo gə́ naḭ ne mee ɓee gə́ Sitim ɓəi ndá, yeḛ ula njétənlooje joo gə goo ŋgəḭ pana: Awje aw tənje loo mee ɓee’g ooje, nɛ oreeje kəm sí ndəŋ dɔ ɓee-boo gə́ Jeriko ya. Deḛ d’ɔd d’aw ndá teḛ kəi lə kaiya-dené gə́ ria lə Rahab, tɔɓəi deḛ to keneŋ tɔ#Ǝbr 11.31, Jak 2.25.
Target: 1Then Joshua son of Nun secretly sent two spies from Shittim. “Go, look over the land,” he said, “especially Jericho.” So they went and entered the house of a prostitute named Rahab and stayed there.

Source: 1Loo gə́ Jabḭ, mbai gə́ Asɔr oo ta néje neelé mba̰ ndá yeḛ ula kula rɔ Jobab, mbai gə́ Mado̰’g ləm, gə rɔ mbai gə́ simro̰’g ləm, gə rɔ mbai gə́ Aksap’g ləm,
Target: 1When Jabin king of Hazor heard of this, he sent word to Jobab king of Madon, to the kings of Shimron and Akshaph,

Source: 1Pakɔs kḭ kaw tuga ne loo ɗao-ɗao gə́ tar.
Target: 1I call on theLordin my distress,

Source: 1Njesigənea̰ ula Jeremi ta gə rɔtaje nee pana:
Target: 1This is the word that came to Jeremiah from theLord:

Source: 1Mee ndəa’g neelé Abija, ŋgolə Jeroboam oso gə rɔko̰.
Target: 1At that time Abijah son of Jeroboam became ill,

Source: 1Dəwje gə́ munda neelé d’əw rɔ dee kila Jɔb ta’g. Mbata yeḛ oo rəa gə́ dəw gə́ njera nédanasur.
Target: 1So these three men stopped answering Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

Source: 1Yen ŋga, Jeju pata ar boo-dəwje gə́ nai rəa’g ləm, gə njékwakiláje ləm tɔ pana:
Target: 1Then Jesus said to the crowds and to his disciples:

Source: 1Goo kwəi’g lə Abimelek lé Tola, ŋgolə Pua, gə́ to ŋgolə Dodo, gə́ to gə́ ginkoji gə́ lə Isakar lé ḭ gə mba taa dɔ Israɛlje, yeḛ si Samir, dɔ mbal’d gə́ Eprayim tɔ.
Target: 1After the time of Abimelek, a man of Issachar named Tola son of Puah, the son of Dodo, rose to save Israel. He lived in Shamir, in the hill country of Ephraim.

Source: 1Dəwje gə́ Jip d’aw rɔ Sawul’g loo gə́ Gibea’g d’aw d’ulá pana: See Dabid iya rəa dɔdərloo gə́ Hakila gə́ wɔji dɔ dɔdilaloo njoroŋ lé el wa#Pak 54.1-2.
Target: 1The Ziphites went to Saul at Gibeah and said, “Is not David hiding on the hill of Hakilah, which faces Jeshimon?”

Source: 1Nɛ Sool lé rɔ gə njékwakila lə Mbaidɔmbaije lé əmə tar biriri-biriri ndəji dee kɔr.
Target: 1Meanwhile, Saul was still breathing out murderous threats against the Lord’s disciples. He went to the high priest

Source: 1Eli, dəw gə́ Tisbe gə́ dɔ naŋg gə́ Galaad lé ula Akab pana: Njesigənea̰ Ala lə Israɛlje gə́ m’to kura ləa lé to Njesikəmba! Mee ləbje’g neelé tàl a kwa el ləm, ndi kara a kər el ləm tɔ nɛ gə goo ta gə́ ma nja m’a pa ɓa#Jak 5.17.
Target: 1Now Elijah the Tishbite, from Tishbe#17:1OrTishbite, of the settlersin Gilead, said to Ahab, “As theLord, the God of Israel, lives, whom I serve, there will be neither dew nor rain in the next few years except at my word.”

Source: 1Ma lé m’isi loo-kula-ŋgəm-loo’g ləm,
Target: 1I will stand at my watch

Source: 1Balaam oo to gə́ mee Njesigənea̰ lelee mba karee tɔr ndia dɔ Israɛlje’g ndá, yeḛ aw mba saŋg nésukəmlooje to gə́ kédé lé el ŋga nɛ yeḛ tel kəmee par gə́ dɔdilaloo’g ɓa.
Target: 1Now when Balaam saw that it pleased theLordto bless Israel, he did not resort to divination as at other times, but turned his face toward the wilderness.

Source: 1I dəw gə́ ban-ban kara gə́ wa rɔi gə́ njegaŋ-rəwta dɔ marije’g lé loo kari taa ne dɔi godo. Mbata loo gə́ i gaŋg rəwta dɔ dee’g lé i nja kara ila ne ta dɔ rɔi’g ya to mbata i gə́ njegaŋ-rəwta dɔ dee’g lé i nja kara to gə́ njera néje neelé to gə́ deḛ bèe tɔ#Mat 7.1, Lug 6.37.
Target: 1You, therefore, have no excuse, you who pass judgment on someone else, for at whatever point you judge another, you are condemning yourself, because you who pass judgment do the same things.

Source: 1Ginka Jeju Kristi, yeḛ gə́ to ŋgoka Dabid ləm, gə ŋgoka Abrakam ləm tɔ.
Target: 1This is the genealogy#1:1Oris an account of the originof Jesus the Messiah#1:1OrJesus Christ.Messiah(Hebrew) andChrist(Greek) both meanAnointed One; also in verse 18.the son of David, the son of Abraham:

Source: 1Ma Pool, njekaḭkula gə́ ḭ rɔ dəwje’g el ləm, dəw kára kara ɔrm undam el ləm tɔ nɛ Jeju Kristi ləm, gə Ala, Bɔ-dəwje gə́ njekaree unda loo teḛ dan njé gə́ d’wəi’g ləm tɔ lé deḛ nja ɓa d’ɔrm d’undam gə́ njekaḭkula ya.
Target: 1Paul, an apostle—sent not from men nor by a man, but by Jesus Christ and God the Father, who raised him from the dead—

Source: 1Elipaj, dəw gə́ Teman un ta pa pana:
Target: 1Then Eliphaz the Temanite replied:

Source: 1Eliasib gə́ to ŋgɔ-njekinjanéməs lé ḭ gə ŋgakea̰je gə́ to njékinjanéməsje ar dee ra tarəwkɔg gə́ ria lə Rəw lə Badje lé. Deḛ d’unda gə kəmee ləm, gə tula tabidi-rəwje keneŋ ləm tɔ. Deḛ d’unda gə kəmee un kudee dɔ kəi-kaar-kɔgərɔ gə́ duu dɔ loo gə́ ria lə Méa saar teḛ ne kəi-kaar-kɔgərɔ gə́ duu dɔ loo gə́ ria lə Hananeel tɔ.
Target: 1Eliashib the high priest and his fellow priests went to work and rebuilt the Sheep Gate. They dedicated it and set its doors in place, building as far as the Tower of the Hundred, which they dedicated, and as far as the Tower of Hananel.

Source: 1Sedesias lé ləbee as rɔ-joo-giree-kára ɓa yeḛ tel to mbai ndá yeḛ si Jerusalem o̰ ne ɓee as ləb dɔg-giree-kára. Kea̰je ria lə Hamutal, ŋgolə Jeremi gə́ to dəw gə́ Libna.
Target: 1Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eleven years. His mother’s name was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah; she was from Libnah.

Source: 1Ma m’ula sí ta néje neelé gə mba karee tel to né kɔr koso lə sí el.
Target: 1“All this I have told you so that you will not fall away.

Source: 1Ma m’tɔgi no̰ Ala’g ləm, gə no̰ Jeju Kristi’g gə́ a gə gaŋg rəwta dɔ deḛ gə́ d’isi kəmba gə deḛ gə́ d’wəi’g ləma, gə ri yeḛ gə́ a gə tel ree gə ɓeeko̰ ləa ləm tɔ,
Target: 1In the presence of God and of Christ Jesus, who will judge the living and the dead, and in view of his appearing and his kingdom, I give you this charge:

Source: 1Mee naḭ gə́ ɓaree Nisa̰, mee ləb gə́ njekɔm’g rɔ-joo gə́ Artajerjɛs to ne mbai lé, loo gə́ yeḛ si ta ka-nésɔ’g ndá m’a gə kun mán-nduú gə́ mḭ lé kar mbai lé ya. Nɛ ma lé kédé m’aar nea̰’g m’ar kəm to ndòo ndɔ kára kara bèe el.
Target: 1In the month of Nisan in the twentieth year of King Artaxerxes, when wine was brought for him, I took the wine and gave it to the king. I had not been sad in his presence before,

Source: 1Gelee gə́ neelé ɓa, jeḛ gə́ Ala ɔm kula neelé ji sí’g gə goo meekɔrjol ləa lé meḛ sí ila ne kas el.
Target: 1Therefore, since through God’s mercy we have this ministry, we do not lose heart.

Source: 1Loo gə́ Piɛrə gə Ja̰ d’isi d’ula dəwje ta bèe-bèe ndá njékinjanéməsje gə njeŋgəm kəi-Ala gə Saduseḛje ree d’iŋga dee dɔ’g.
Target: 1The priests and the captain of the temple guard and the Sadducees came up to Peter and John while they were speaking to the people.

Source: 1Né gə́ to ɓəl kədm-kədm teḛ dara: Kàr dəb dɔ dené’g aree ɔm gɔlee dɔ naḭ’g ləm, ar kéréméje dɔg-gir-dee-joo to dɔgugu kula dəa’g ləm tɔ.
Target: 1A great sign appeared in heaven: a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon under her feet and a crown of twelve stars on her head.

Source: 1Aa ooje, ndɔ oŋg lə Njesigənea̰ si aw gə́ nee dəb ŋga
Target: 1A day of theLordis coming, Jerusalem, when your possessions will be plundered and divided up within your very walls.

Source: 1Ləb ko̰ɓee lə Jojakim, mbai gə́ Juda gə́ njekɔm’g munda lé Nebukadnesar, mbai gə́ Babilɔn aḭ dɔ ɓee gə́ Jerusalem sub gə rɔ#2Mb 24.1, 2SgI 36.5-7.
Target: 1In the third year of the reign of Jehoiakim king of Judah, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came to Jerusalem and besieged it.

Source: 1Aa ooje, ri mbaije gə́ Israɛlje dum dɔ dee ləm, gə taa ɓee lə dee gə́ to kel tura-baa gə́ Jurdɛ̰ gə́ nu loo kuba gə́ lə kàr, un kudee baa gə́ Arno̰ saar teḛ ne mbal gə́ Hermo̰, gə ndag-loo gə́ to par gə́ bər bura ləm tɔ lé ɓa nee#BI 21.21-35, TtG 2.26–3.11:
Target: 1These are the kings of the land whom the Israelites had defeated and whose territory they took over east of the Jordan, from the Arnon Gorge to Mount Hermon, including all the eastern side of the Arabah:

Source: 1Yeḛ ulam pana: Ma ŋgon-dəw lé maji kam m’usɔ né gə́ ma m’iŋga lé, m’usɔ maktub gə́ kə́ na̰’d neelé ndá m’aw m’ula gel-bɔje lə Israɛl ta#LkJ 10.9-10!
Target: 1And he said to me, “Son of man, eat what is before you, eat this scroll; then go and speak to the people of Israel.”

Source: 1Moyis ḭ ndag-looje gə́ Moab tuga dɔ mbal gə́ Nebo aw dɔ sém mbal gə́ Pisga gə́ wɔji dɔ Jeriko njoroŋ. Ndá Njesigənea̰ aree oo ɓeeje lai tɔ, bèe ɓa,
Target: 1Then Moses climbed Mount Nebo from the plains of Moab to the top of Pisgah, across from Jericho. There theLordshowed him the whole land—from Gilead to Dan,

Source: 1Ndɔ gə́ dɔtar gə́ lə naḭ gə́ njekɔm’g siri lé a to ndɔ mbo̰ dɔ na̰ gə́ to gə kəmee: seḭ a raje kula gə́ seḭ aw raje ta-ta lé el. Ndɔ neelé d’a kim to̰to̰je ɓa kila ne mberee mbuna sí’g.
Target: 1“ ‘On the first day of the seventh month hold a sacred assembly and do no regular work. It is a day for you to sound the trumpets.
